page.title: 08VILLAGE PLANNING - HALSETOWN
page.content: Here{local history}deserves a mention as Halsetown is Europe's first planned village.In 1832 James Halse, a local mining adventurer, built it to house his workers and gave it his name. Each cottage sits upon a third of an acre plot, which by the then new land reform laws,gave the tenant{franchise. In this way Halse made sure of his miners' votes, and regained his seat as M.P. for St.Ives. A vantage point on the road to Penzance gives a clear view of the{ {straight rows of cottages}in their gardens of exactly similar size. They are linked by lanes just wide enough for a car. Luckily a conservation order has preserved the appearance of the village. Despite this, some have obtained permission to put another house on their plot. One hopes the unique lay-out will be preserved.
